patterns: Tell me about the history of the university.
What are some interesting facts about the university?
Who are you guys?
Tell me about the school?
responses: Lamar University is a public university in Beaumont, Texas. Lamar has been a member of the Texas State University System since 1995. It was the flagship institution of the former Lamar University System. Click here to Visit the web page to understand more about the University.

patterns: How do high school graduates apply to this university?
What steps do I need to take for the freshman application?
Can you provide details about the application process for incoming freshmen?
I'm a high school senior. What's the procedure for applying as a freshman?
Where can I find the application form for freshmen?
responses: Complete the online application through link .Submit your official high school transcript(s): Have your high school send electronically through Trex, Speedy or Escript Mail to our Admissions Office – P.O. Box 10009, Beaumont TX 77710 .Drop it off in-person .Go to link for further details.

patterns: What are the specific requirements for graduate school applications?
Can you walk me through the application process for graduate programs?
I'm interested in pursuing a master's degree. How do I apply?
Where can I find information on applying to the graduate school?
What documents are needed for the graduate application?
responses: Complete the online application through link Submit official transcripts/evaluations for: - The conferred bachelor's or master's degree required for the intended program from a regionally accredited US institution or its equivalent.- The most recent institution of attendance if it differs from the institution of the conferred degree. Submit scores on the GRE or GMAT* Both tests are administered by the LU Career & Testing Center.Use school code 6360 for GRE. Go to link for further details.
next_questions: What are the application deadlines?
What are the admission requirements?
How does the application process differ for international students?
Online Course Evaluations

patterns: How does the application process differ for international students?
What are the additional steps for international applicants?
Can you guide me on applying to the university as an international student?
I'm from [Country]. What are the specific requirements for international applicants?
Where can I get information on visa processes for international students?
responses: Complete the online application through link - First-time Undergraduate International (Freshman): Submit an evaluation of your foreign high school transcripts.- Undergraduate Transfer International Student: Submit official college transcripts from ALL colleges attended. If you have less than 18 college credit hours, submit an evaluation of your foreign high school transcripts.- New or Transfer Graduate International student: Submit official college transcripts from ALL colleges attended.Go to link for further details.
next_questions: What are the application deadlines?
What are the admission requirements?
How does the application process differ for international students?
Online Course Evaluations

patterns: I already have a degree. How can I apply for a post-degree program?

Can you provide details about applying for post-degree studies?
Where can I find information on post-degree application requirements?
What are the steps for someone with a degree to apply for further studies?
responses: Complete the online application through link .Post Degree applicants should submit an online U.S. Graduate Application through the statewide Apply Texas system.Students should also have official copies of all prior college and university transcripts sent to Lamar University, regardless of the length of attendance and whether credit was earned.Go to link for further details.

patterns: What art and cultural events are happening on campus?
Tell me about the art and cultural scene at the university.
Are there any art exhibitions or cultural performances coming up?
Can you recommend cultural activities for students?
responses: Creative minds come alive at LU. Take a look at the latest museum exhibits on campus, attend a lecture event, enjoy a performance at the theatre, or use this handy guide to learn more about all of the public art on campus. Go to link for further details.

patterns: How can I join clubs and organizations on campus?
Tell me about the student clubs and organizations available.
What clubs are there for [specific interest]?
Give me information about joining student groups.
responses: With more than 150 registered student clubs and organizations, you'll have plenty of opportunities to meet classmates with similar interests. Choose from a wide variety of intramural sports, fraternities, sororities, academic clubs, and special interest groups to make lifelong friends. Go to link to know more.

patterns: Can you recommend interesting places to visit on campus?
Tell me about notable locations around the university.
Where are the key places on campus?
What are the popular spots for students?
responses: Campus life at Lamar University is the perfect blend of urban living with the close community feel of a small town. Between classes, you can stroll through campus to admire the artwork and mature oak trees. Study with friends at the Mary & John Gray library, or lounge at the Setzer Student Center. Go to link to know more.

responses: LU has a healthy option for everyone. Watch the Cardinals compete in 15 sports, get involved in a group fitness class at the gym, or join classmates in a wide variety of intramural teams. Go to link for further details.

patterns: Where can I find dining options on campus?

responses: When it comes to food, LU has something for everyone. Stop by Starbucks in the library for coffee and a bite, or check out any of the restaurants on campus! Brooks-Shivers Dining Hall Chick-fil-A, Panda Express, Smoothie King, Starbucks, Papa John's Pizza, Tiny House BBQ, Market – Cardinal Village, Market – Setzer Student Center, Market – Brooks-Shivers. Go to link for further details.
